Allan Gray Digital Style Guide
Colours Layouts Tables Typography Utilities

CSS Utilities

Some utility classes that can be used almost anywhere.

Colours

Class name Effect Remarks
.color-primary Sets the text colour to be the primary brand colour Optional.
.color-secondary Sets the text colour to be the secondary brand colour Optional.
.color-grey-darkest Sets the text colour to be the darkest-grey brand colour Optional.

Cell alignment

Class name Effect Remarks
.vertical-align-top Aligns .cell elements to the top of their .grid-row Optional. Default for .cells.
.vertical-align-middle Aligns .cell elements to the middle of their .grid-row Optional.
.vertical-align-bottom Aligns .cell elements to the bottom of their .grid-row Optional.

Text utilities

Class name Effect Remarks
.text-align-left Aligns text to the left Optional.
.text-align-center Center aligns the text Optional.
.text-align-right Aligns text to the right Optional.
.text-uppercase Converts the text to uppercase. Don't type in uppercase. Optional.
Use this instead of typing in caps.
Screen readers read caps as initialisms.
.monospace Sets the text to use the monospace font Required when displaying numerical data

Font weights

Class name Effect Remarks
.semibold Makes the font weight semibold Optional.

Dividers

Class name Effect Remarks
.divider Sets up the element to be a divider component Required.
.divider--dotted Makes the dividing line a dotted one. Optional.
.divider--solid Makes the dividing line a solid one. Optional.

Margins & padding

Class name Effect Remarks
.margin-none Removes any margin on the element Optional.
.padding-none Removes any padding on the element Optional.
